item.title: ğŸŒ Today marks the beginning of the Bank of Japan's annual meeting, where its bond market strategy wi...
item.description: ğŸŒ Today marks the beginning of the Bank of Japan's annual meeting, where its bond market strategy will be discussed. Japan's Q3 GDP data will be released at 02:50 MSK. China's trade figures for November will be available at 06:00 MSK. Germany's industrial production for October is set to be published at 10:00 MSK. U.S. inflation expectations for November will be announced at 19:00 MSK. Additionally, Macron is scheduled to meet with Zelensky, Starmer, and Merz. In related news, Russia has lifted restrictions on overseas fund transfers for certain citizens, allowing foreign investors to open special accounts on MOEX.

item.title: ğŸŒ Today marks the commencement of the Bank of Japan's annual meeting, where the focus will be on its...
item.description: ğŸŒ Today marks the commencement of the Bank of Japan's annual meeting, where the focus will be on its bond market strategy. Japan's Q3 GDP data is scheduled for release at 02:50 MSK. China's trade figures for November will be available at 06:00 MSK, while Germany's October industrial production data is expected at 10:00 MSK. In the U.S., inflation expectations for November will be disclosed at 19:00 MSK. Additionally, President Macron is set to meet with Zelensky, Starmer, and Merz. In a significant move, Russia has lifted restrictions on overseas fund transfers for certain citizens, and foreign investors can now open special accounts on MOEX.

item.description: â—ï¸ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ In Q3 2025, Japan's GDP contracted by 0.6% compared to the previous quarter and by 2.3% year-on-year, surpassing forecasts of -0.4% and -1.8%, respectively. This represents the first decline in six months, strengthening the argument for the stimulus measures introduced by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi last month. â€” BBG

item.title: ğŸŒ In November, China's exports rose by 5.9% compared to the same month last year, surpassing expecta...
item.description: ğŸŒ In November, China's exports rose by 5.9% compared to the same month last year, surpassing expectations of 3.8% and rebounding from a prior decline of 1.1%. Imports saw a year-on-year increase of 1.9%, falling short of the predicted 2.8% but showing an improvement from last month's growth of 1%. Notably, China's trade surplus has exceeded $1 trillion for the first time.

item.description: âš ï¸ Former U.S. President Donald Trump has weighed in on the ongoing conflict between Ukraine and Russia. However, he expressed doubt about whether Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky considers it acceptable, mentioning that he has not reviewed the plan himself.

Furthermore, the selection volume amounted to 5,547 million rubles, indicating a 22.3% decrease from the previous year.
